qas.question: If Neptune formed closer to the sun, what is the matter density?
If Neptune formed closer to the sun, what caused it to migrate to it's current orbit?

answers.text: removal of the gaseous protoplanetary disc

qas.question: What is the most widely accepted explanation of Neptune's formation called?
What does The Nice model consider effected the migration of Neptune?
If Jupiter formed closer to the sun, what is the matter density?

plausible_answers.text: removal of the gaseous protoplanetary disc

qas.question: If Pluto formed closer to the sun, what caused it to migrate to it's current orbit?
What is the least widely accepted explanation of Neptune's formation called?
What does The Nice model consider effected the migration of Jupiter?

context: An alternative concept is that they formed closer to the Sun, where the matter density was <a0_0><b4_0>higher<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and then subsequently migrated to their current orbits after the <a1_0><b5_0>removal of the gaseous protoplanetary disc<b5_0/><a1_0/>. This hypothesis of migration after formation is favoured, due to its ability to better explain the occupancy of the populations of small objects observed in the trans-Neptunian region. The current most widely accepted explanation of the details of this hypothesis is known as <a2_0>the <b6_0>Nice model<b6_0/><a2_0/>, which explores the effect of a migrating Neptune and the other giant planets on the structure of the <a3_0><b7_0>Kuiper belt<b7_0/>.
